glsa.title: Fetchmail: Denial of Service and password disclosure
glsa.synopsis: Fetchmail has been found to have numerous vulnerabilities allowing for Denial of Service and password disclosure.

background.p: Fetchmail is a remote mail retrieval and forwarding utility.

description.p: Neil Hoggarth has discovered that when delivering messages to a message delivery agent by means of the "mda" option, Fetchmail passes a NULL pointer to the ferror() and fflush() functions when refusing a message. Isaac Wilcox has discovered numerous means of plain-text password disclosure due to errors in secure connection establishment.

impact.p: An attacker could deliver a message via Fetchmail to a message delivery agent configured to refuse the message, and crash the Fetchmail process. SMTP and LMTP delivery modes are not affected by this vulnerability. An attacker could also perform a Man-in-the-Middle attack, and obtain plain-text authentication credentials of users connecting to a Fetchmail process.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
